ddf.catalog.impl

Class CatalogFrameworkImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ddf.catalog.util.impl.DescribableImpl
      • ddf.catalog.impl.CatalogFrameworkImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CatalogFramework, Describable

    public class CatalogFrameworkImpl
extends DescribableImpl
implements CatalogFramework
    CatalogFrameworkImpl is the core class of DDF. It is used for query, create, update, delete, and resource retrieval operations.

      protected void validateCreateRequest(CreateRequest createRequest)
      Validates that the CreateRequest is non-null and has a non-empty list of Metacards in it.
      protected void validateCreateStorageRequest(CreateStorageRequest createRequest)
      Validates that the CreateStorageRequest is non-null and has a non-empty list of ContentItems in it.
      protected void validateDeleteRequest(DeleteRequest deleteRequest)
      Validates that the DeleteRequest is non-null, has a non-empty list of Metacards in it, and a non-null attribute name (which specifies if the delete is being done by product URI or ID).
      protected CreateResponse validateFixCreateResponse(CreateResponse createResponse, CreateRequest createRequest)
      Validates that the CreateResponse has one or more Metacards in it that were created in the catalog, and that the original CreateRequest is included in the response.
      protected DeleteResponse validateFixDeleteResponse(DeleteResponse deleteResponse, DeleteRequest deleteRequest)
      Validates that the DeleteResponse has one or more Metacards in it that were deleted in the catalog, and that the original DeleteRequest is included in the response.
      protected ResourceResponse validateFixGetResourceResponse(ResourceResponse getResourceResponse, ResourceRequest getResourceRequest)
      Validates that the ResourceResponse has a Resource in it that was retrieved, and that the original ResourceRequest is included in the response.
      protected SourceResponse validateFixQueryResponse(SourceResponse sourceResponse, QueryRequest queryRequest, boolean overrideFanoutRename)
      Validates that the QueryResponse has a non-null list of Results in it, and that the original QueryRequest is included in the response.
      protected UpdateResponse validateFixUpdateResponse(UpdateResponse updateResponse, UpdateRequest updateRequest)
      Validates that the UpdateResponse has one or more Metacards in it that were updated in the catalog, and that the original UpdateRequest is included in the response.
      protected void validateGetResourceRequest(ResourceRequest getResourceRequest)
      Validates that the ResourceRequest is non-null, a non-null attribute name (which specifies if the retrieval is being done by product URI or ID), and a non-null attribute value.
      protected void validateQueryRequest(QueryRequest queryRequest)
      Validates that the QueryRequest is non-null and that the query in it is non-null.
      protected void validateUpdateRequest(UpdateRequest updateRequest)
      Validates that the UpdateRequest is non-null, has a non-empty list of Metacards in it, and a non-null attribute name (which specifies if the update is being done by product URI or ID).
      protected void validateUpdateStorageRequest(UpdateStorageRequest updateRequest)
      Validates that the UpdateStorageRequest is non-null, has a non-empty list of ContentItems in it.

      • bind

        public void bind(CatalogProvider catalogProvider)
        Invoked by blueprint when a CatalogProvider is created and bound to this CatalogFramework instance.

        The local catalog provider will be set to the first item in the List of CatalogProviders bound to this CatalogFramework.

        Parameters:
        catalogProvider - the CatalogProvider being bound to this CatalogFramework instance

      • unbind

        public void unbind(CatalogProvider catalogProvider)
        Invoked by blueprint when a CatalogProvider is deleted and unbound from this CatalogFramework instance.

        The local catalog provider will be reset to the new first item in the List of CatalogProviders bound to this CatalogFramework. If this list of catalog providers is currently empty, then the local catalog provider will be set to null.

        Parameters:
        catalogProvider - the CatalogProvider being unbound from this CatalogFramework instance

      • bind

        public void bind(StorageProvider storageProvider)
        Invoked by blueprint when a StorageProvider is created and bound to this CatalogFramework instance.

        The local storage provider will be set to the first item in the List of StorageProviders bound to this CatalogFramework.

        Parameters:
        storageProvider - the CatalogProvider being bound to this CatalogFramework instance

      • unbind

        public void unbind(StorageProvider storageProvider)
        Invoked by blueprint when a StorageProvider is deleted and unbound from this CatalogFramework instance.

        The local storage provider will be reset to the new first item in the List of StorageProviders bound to this CatalogFramework. If this list of storage providers is currently empty, then the local storage provider will be set to null.

        Parameters:
        storageProvider - the StorageProvider being unbound from this CatalogFramework instance

      • getSourceInfo

        public SourceInfoResponse getSourceInfo(SourceInfoRequest sourceInfoRequest)
                                 throws SourceUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Returns information for each Source that is endpoint-addressable in CatalogFramework, including its own CatalogProvider, based on the contents of the SourceInfoRequest. The SourceInfoRequest specifies either:
        1. an enterprise source search, which includes the catalog provider and all federated and connected sources
        2. a list of requested source IDs, which are all federated sources
        3. the catalog provider only
        Specified by:
        getSourceInfo in interface CatalogFramework
        Parameters:
        sourceInfoRequest - the SourceInfoRequest
        Returns:
        SourceInfoResponse
        Throws:
        SourceUnavailableException - if the source indicated in the SourceInfoRequest is null, not found, or cannot provide the requested information

      • getFanoutSourceInfo

        public SourceInfoResponse getFanoutSourceInfo(SourceInfoRequest sourceInfoRequest)
                                       throws SourceUnavailableException
        Retrieves the SourceDescriptor info for all FederatedSources in the fanout configuration, but the all of the source info, e.g., content types, for all of the available FederatedSources is packed into one SourceDescriptor for the fanout configuration with the fanout's site name in it. This keeps the individual FederatedSources' source info hidden from the external client.
        Throws:
        SourceUnavailableException

      • addCatalogSourceDescriptor

        protected void addCatalogSourceDescriptor(Set<SourceDescriptor> descriptors)
        Adds the local catalog's SourceDescriptor to the set of SourceDescriptors for this framework.
        Parameters:
        descriptors - the set of SourceDescriptors to add the local catalog's descriptor to

      • create

        public CreateResponse create(CreateStorageRequest streamCreateRequest)
                      throws IngestException,
                             SourceUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework

        This code is experimental. While this interface is functional and tested, it may change or be removed in a future version of the library.

        Creates Metacards in the CatalogProvider.

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Before evaluation, call PreIngestPlugin.process(CreateRequest) for each registered PreIngestPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        2. Call CatalogProvider.create(CreateRequest) on the registered CatalogProvider
        3. Call PostIngestPlugin.process(CreateResponse) for each registered PostIngestPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        4. Call PreCreateStoragePlugin.process(CreateStorageRequest) for each registered PreCreateStoragePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        5. Call StorageProvider.create(CreateStorageRequest) on the registered CatalogProvider
        6. Call PostCreateStoragePlugin.process(ddf.catalog.content.operation.CreateStorageResponse) for each registered PostCreateStoragePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.

        Specified by:
        create in interface CatalogFramework
        Parameters:
        streamCreateRequest - the CreateStorageRequest
        Returns:
        CreateResponse
        Throws:
        IngestException - if an issue occurs during the update
        SourceUnavailableException - if the source being updated is unavailable

      • create

        public CreateResponse create(CreateRequest createRequest)
                      throws IngestException,
                             SourceUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Creates Metacards in the CatalogProvider.

        2. Call CatalogProvider.create(CreateRequest) on the registered CatalogProvider
        3. Call PostIngestPlugin.process(CreateResponse) for each registered PostIngestPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        SourceUnavailableException - if the source being updated is unavailable

      • update

        public UpdateResponse update(UpdateStorageRequest streamUpdateRequest)
                      throws IngestException,
                             SourceUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework

        This code is experimental. While this interface is functional and tested, it may change or be removed in a future version of the library.

        Updates a list of Metacards. Metacards that are not in the Catalog will not be created. If a Metacard in the list to be updated does not have its ID attribute set, then the associated ID for that Metacard in the UpdateRequest will be used.

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Before evaluation, call PreIngestPlugin.process(UpdateRequest) for each registered PreIngestPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        2. Call CatalogProvider.update(UpdateRequest) on the registered CatalogProvider
        3. Call PostIngestPlugin.process(UpdateResponse) for each registered PostIngestPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        4. Call PreUpdateStoragePlugin.process(UpdateStorageRequest) for each registered PreUpdateStoragePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        5. Call StorageProvider.update(UpdateStorageRequest) on the registered CatalogProvider
        6. Call PostUpdateStoragePlugin.process(ddf.catalog.content.operation.UpdateStorageResponse) for each registered PostUpdateStoragePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.

        Specified by:
        update in interface CatalogFramework
        Parameters:
        streamUpdateRequest - the UpdateStorageRequest
        Returns:
        UpdateResponse
        Throws:
        IngestException - if an issue occurs during the update
        SourceUnavailableException - if the source being updated is unavailable

        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Updates a list of Metacards. Metacards that are not in the Catalog will not be created. If a Metacard in the list to be updated does not have its ID attribute set, then the associated ID for that Metacard in the UpdateRequest will be used.

        1. Before evaluation, call PreIngestPlugin.process(UpdateRequest) for each registered PreIngestPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        2. Call CatalogProvider.update(UpdateRequest) on the registered CatalogProvider
        3. Call PostIngestPlugin.process(UpdateResponse) for each registered PostIngestPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.

      • query

        public QueryResponse query(QueryRequest fedQueryRequest)
                    throws UnsupportedQueryException,
                           FederationException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Evaluates a QueryRequest using the default FederationStrategy

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Before evaluation, call PreQueryPlugin.process(QueryRequest) for each registered PreQueryPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        2. Call Source.query(QueryRequest) on the registered CatalogProvider
        3. Call Source.query(QueryRequest) on all registered ConnectedSources
        4. If applicable, invoke the default FederationStrategy which will call Source.query(QueryRequest) on all registered FederatedSources
        5. Before returning, call PostQueryPlugin.process(QueryResponse) for each registered PostQueryPlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        6. Return the last QueryResponse to the caller.

        Specified by:
        query in interface CatalogFramework
        Parameters:
        fedQueryRequest - the QueryRequest
        Returns:
        QueryResponse the resulting response
        Throws:
        UnsupportedQueryException - if the provided query can not be interpreted by a required Source
        FederationException - if federation is requested but can not complete, usually due to the FederationStrategy
        See Also:
        CatalogFramework.query(QueryRequest, FederationStrategy)

      • connectedSourcesExist

        protected boolean connectedSourcesExist()
        Determines if this catalog framework has any ConnectedSources configured.
        Returns:
        true if this framework has any connected sources configured, false otherwise

      • query

        public QueryResponse query(QueryRequest queryRequest,
                           FederationStrategy strategy)
                    throws UnsupportedQueryException,
                           FederationException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Evaluates and executes a QueryRequest using the FederationStrategy provided.

        Implementations of this method must implement all of the rules defined in CatalogFramework.query(QueryRequest), but use the specified FederationStrategy

        Specified by:
        query in interface CatalogFramework
        Parameters:
        queryRequest - the QueryRequest
        strategy - the FederationStrategy to use
        Returns:
        QueryResponse the resulting response
        Throws:
        UnsupportedQueryException - if the Query can not be evaluated by this CatalogFramework or any of its Sources.
        FederationException - if the QueryRequest includes FederatedSources and there is either a problem connecting to a FederatedSource or a FederatedSource cannot evaluate the Query

        public QueryResponse query(QueryRequest queryRequest,
                           FederationStrategy strategy,
                           boolean overrideFanoutRename)
                    throws UnsupportedQueryException,
                           FederationException
        Throws:
        UnsupportedQueryException
        FederationException

        exceptions - the set of exceptions to include in the response's ProcessingDetails. Can be empty, but cannot be null.

        Returns:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        CatalogTransformerException - if there is a problem transforming the Metacard

        arguments - to be used by the the transformer, if applicable
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getLocalResource

        public ResourceResponse getLocalResource(ResourceRequest resourceRequest)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         ResourceNotFoundException,
                                         ResourceNotSupportedException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Evaluate a ResourceRequest using available ResourceReaders (does not attempt to locate the resource via federation).

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Before evaluation, call PreResourcePlugin.process(ResourceRequest) for each registered PreResourcePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        2. If not provided with a java.net.URI ( ResourceRequest.GET_RESOURCE_BY_PRODUCT_URI.equals(ResourceRequest.getAttributeName())==false ) , retrieve the matching Metacard and get its Product java.net.URI.
        3. Locate the ResourceReader that supports the URI.getScheme() of the java.net.URI on the OSGi Registry.
        4. Call ResourceReader.retrieveResource(java.net.URI, Map)
        5. Call PostResourcePlugin.process(ResourceResponse) for each registered PostResourcePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.

        Specified by:
        getLocalResource in interface CatalogFramework
        Parameters:
        resourceRequest - the ResourceRequest
        Returns:
        ResourceResponse
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem communicating with the system containing the resource
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the requested resource was not found
        ResourceNotSupportedException - if the scheme used in the associated java.net.URI is not supported by this CatalogFramework

      • getResource

        public ResourceResponse getResource(ResourceRequest resourceRequest,
                                    String resourceSiteName)
                             throws IOException,
                                    ResourceNotFoundException,
                                    ResourceNotSupportedException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Evaluate a ResourceRequest using the specified site name.

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Before evaluation, call PreResourcePlugin.process(ResourceRequest) for each registered PreResourcePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        2. If not provided with a java.net.URI ( ResourceRequest.GET_RESOURCE_BY_PRODUCT_URI.equals(ResourceRequest.getAttributeName())==false ) , retrieve the matching Metacard and get its Product java.net.URI.
        3. Locate the ResourceReader that supports the URI.getScheme() of the java.net.URI on the OSGi Registry.
        4. Call ResourceReader.retrieveResource(java.net.URI, Map)
        5. Call PostResourcePlugin.process(ResourceResponse) for each registered PostResourcePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.

        Specified by:
        getResource in interface CatalogFramework
        Parameters:
        resourceRequest - the ResourceRequest
        resourceSiteName - name of the site/source to retrieve the resource from
        Returns:
        ResourceResponse
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem communicating with the system containing the resource
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the requested resource was not found
        ResourceNotSupportedException - if the scheme used in the associated java.net.URI is not supported by this CatalogFramework

      • getEnterpriseResource

        public ResourceResponse getEnterpriseResource(ResourceRequest resourceRequest)
                                       throws IOException,
                                              ResourceNotFoundException,
                                              ResourceNotSupportedException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Evaluate a ResourceRequest against the local CatalogProvider and RemoteSources.

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Before evaluation, call PreResourcePlugin.process(ResourceRequest) for each registered PreResourcePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.
        2. If not provided with a java.net.URI ( ResourceRequest.GET_RESOURCE_BY_PRODUCT_URI.equals(ResourceRequest.getAttributeName())==false ) , retrieve the matching Metacard and get its Product java.net.URI.
        3. Locate the ResourceReader that supports the URI.getScheme() of the java.net.URI on the OSGi Registry.
        4. Call ResourceReader.retrieveResource(java.net.URI, Map)
        5. Call PostResourcePlugin.process(ResourceResponse) for each registered PostResourcePlugin in order determined by the OSGi SERVICE_RANKING (Descending, highest first), "daisy chaining" their responses to each other.

        Specified by:

        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem communicating with the system containing the resource
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the requested resource was not found
        ResourceNotSupportedException - if the scheme used in the associated java.net.URI is not supported by this CatalogFramework

      • getSourceIds

        public Set<String> getSourceIds()
        Description copied from interface: CatalogFramework
        Return the set of source IDs known to the CatalogFramework. This set includes the local provider and any federated sources, but not connected sources as they are hidden from external clients.
        Specified by:
        getSourceIds in interface CatalogFramework
        Returns:
        Set of source IDs

      • getResourceInfo

                                                            StringBuilder federatedSite,
                                                            Map<String,Serializable> requestProperties)
                                                     throws ResourceNotSupportedException,
                                                            ResourceNotFoundException
        Retrieves a resource by URI.

        The ResourceRequest can specify either the product's URI or ID. If the product ID is specified, then the matching Metacard must first be retrieved and the product URI extracted from this Metacard.

      • replaceSourceId

        protected QueryResponse replaceSourceId(QueryResponse queryResponse)
        Replaces the site name(s) of FederatedSources in the QueryResponse with the fanout's site name to keep info about the FederatedSources hidden from the external client.
        Parameters:
        queryResponse - the original QueryResponse from the query request
        Returns:
        the updated QueryResponse with all site names replaced with fanout's site name
